Reviews.Title: No choice but to return.
Reviews.Author: Jason Obaob
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fix that crazy wifi issue where range is almost nil, even after following online directions.  Sony's own community message boards were over 160 pages last I checked a few weeks ago, full of people complaining about it, and no fix posted from Sony themselves, just user workarounds.

Reviews.Title: Best ultrabook I ever tested.
Reviews.Author: stingray
Reviews.Content: This ultrabook is VERY lightweight  It is perfect for travelling.  I have a Surface Pro as well and prefer this Vaio much more than carrying the Surface Pro brick with its flimsy keyboard.One small issue I have is the sensitivity of the trackpad, which is recognizing too many instances of unintentional 'left clicks' when I am intending to only scroll.A little pricey but its the best ultrabook I ever tested (minus one star for the higher price combined with the finicky trackpad I am experiencing).With its weight, you might even consider getting the 13 inch screen with a slight weight increase.  This 11.6 inch is LIGHT.

Reviews.Title: a good machine, but not worth $1500!
Reviews.Author: 4deliciousnesses
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be better... it's "okay", boots quickly and is fairly good quality...the pros are well covered... the cons:-sharp edges make it uncomfortable for the palms/wrists- scratches easily--no ethernet port (you can buy an external and most places have wifi, but still... for me this was an issue)- only two usbs

Reviews.Title: Stamp of approval!
Reviews.Author: bsbjuicer "bsbjuicer"
Reviews.Content: Super light, super fast and reliable! Nice computer. Only drawbacks are windows 8 (not their fault) and sharp corners. Good job Sony!

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Intel Core i7-4500U 1.8 GHz
8 GB DDR3
256 GB Solid-State Drive
11.6-Inch Screen, Intel HD Graphics 4400
Windows 8 Pro
ProductInfo.Name: Sony VAIO SVP11216PXB 11.6-Inch Touchscreen Ultrabook (Carbon Black)
